channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Has Trump kept his campaign promises to American workers? Here's what some say.
item.description: Trump made many promises to American workers during the campaign trail. Seven months into his second term, we take a look at how he is doing.

item.title: Earthquake devastates eastern Afghanistan, killing hundreds and destroying villages
item.description: The 6.0 magnitude quake late Sunday hit a series of towns in the province of Kunar, near the city of Jalalabad in neighboring Nangahar province, causi...

item.title: How Trump is decimating federal employee unions one step at a time
item.description: President Trump has ended collective bargaining rights for more than one million federal workers. Unions have sued to block the move, but agencies are...

item.title: More students head back to class without one crucial thing: their phones
item.description: This back to school season, more districts than ever have cell phone bans in place. Teachers and legislators alike say the restrictions help kids focu...

item.title: Guatemala says it suggested that U.S. send its unaccompanied migrant children home
item.description: As a U.S. federal judge blocked the deportation of unaccompanied Guatemalan children, the government of Guatemala says in a statement it suggested the...

item.title: 8/31/2025: China's Spies; St. Mary's; Sounds of Cajun Country
item.description: First, a report on China expanding its spying efforts in the U.S. Then, a look at teens’ innovative Pythagorean Theorem work. And, why the music of Ca...

item.title: Mob burns Nigerian woman to death for alleged blasphemy
item.description: Police have condemned the killing as "jungle justice" vowing to bring the perpetrators to justice.

item.title: UN chief demands release of 11 staff arrested in Yemen
item.description: The food and children's agency workers are the latest UN staff detained by Houthi authorities.

item.title: More than 800 people killed by powerful quake in eastern Afghanistan
item.description: An earthquake with a magnitude of 6 hit eastern Afghanistan, destroying multiple villages and killing more than 800 people, officials say.

item.title: Judge blocks Trump administration move to deport Guatemalan children
item.description: Advocacy groups sought emergency action amid reports planes carrying the children were about to take off.

item.title: Senior U.S. Senator calls Taiwan "a free country," as China condemns visit
item.description: Sen. Roger Wicker, visiting Taiwan, called the island claimed by China a "free country." Beijing condemned the visit itself as a "serious violation" o...

item.title: 8/31: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker defiant as Trump threatens to send military to Chicago over crime; Artists turning trash into masterpieces

item.title: See what's open and closed on Labor Day 2025
item.description: Most retail stores, grocery chains and fast-food chains will be open on Labor Day. Here's what to know.

item.title: Fugitive wanted over Australia police killings being helped, police say
item.description: Dezi Freeman vanished into thick bushland after killing two police officers and hasn't been seen since.

item.title: Putin says he reached 'understandings' with Trump over end of Ukraine war
item.description: The Russian president also defended his decision to invade Ukraine, once again blaming the war on the West.

item.title: Trump taps federal agents to tackle local policing. That’s not always helpful, critics say
Montana man who evaded authorities for a week after bar shooting faces four counts of murder
Boy wounded in Minnesota church shooting asks doctor: ‘Can you say a prayer with me?’
